integer and signed constants in algola few remarks are given on the relations betweensyntax and semantics in the programming languages the aim is to point out that if it is true that the grammarof a context-free language should be conceived not only as a strings-generating device but also as amethod for expressing a meaning then the grammar of algol is open to some criticism.cacm december 1964petrone l.vandoni c e.ca641222 jb march 9 1978 2:35 pm1086 4 9491102 4 9491132 4 9491142 4 9491234 4 9491263 4 9491265 4 9491270 4 9491323 4 9491358 4 9491379 4 9491380 4 9491453 4 9491464 4 9491484 4 9491491 4 9491498 4 9491613 4 9491614 4 9491781 4 9491781 4 9491781 4 9491825 4 9491860 4 9491945 4 9491945 4 9492083 4 9492178 4 9492179 4 9492252 4 9492325 4 9492341 4 9492546 4 9492645 4 9492652 4 9492684 4 9492842 4 9492929 4 9492934 4 9493069 4 949669 4 949679 4 949691 4 949761 4 949762 4 949949 4 949949 4 949949 4 949989 4 949949 5 949949 5 949949 5 949483 5 949584 5 9493184 5 949
